example.context:
Lido DAO | Lido Docs

Lido DAO

Lido DAO

The Lido DAO is a Decentralised Autonomous Organisation that manages the liquid staking protocols by deciding on key parameters (e.g., setting fees, assigning node operators and oracles, etc.) through the voting power of governance token (LDO) holders. Also, the DAO will accumulate service fees and spend them on research, development, liquidity mining incentives and protocol upgrades. 

Why DAO?​

The DAO is the logical compromise between full centralization and decentralisation, which allows the deployment of competitive products without full centralization and custody on the exchanges. We do not believe that it is possible to make a liquid staking protocol that is completely trustless. A DAO is an optimal structure for launching Lido as:

The DAO will accumulate service fees from Lido, which is funnelled into the insurance and development funds, distributed by the DAO.

Functions​

interactions.response: The Lido DAO is a Decentralised Autonomous Organisation that manages the liquid staking protocols by deciding on key parameters (e.g., setting fees, assigning node operators and oracles, etc.) through the voting power of governance token (LDO) holders.

interactions.input: What is the purpose of the DAO?
interactions.response: The purpose of the DAO is to allow the deployment of competitive products without full centralization and custody on the exchanges, and to accumulate service fees from Lido, which is funnelled into the insurance and development funds, distributed by the DAO.

responses: The Lido DAO is a decentralized application for DeFi staking and yield farming. With the Lido DAO, users can stake their assets to receive a portion of the rewards earned by the protocol.

The purpose of the Lido DAO is to provide users with the ability to earn rewards and grow their assets by staking them. The rewards earned are derived from the fees generated by the applications built on the Lido network.
